holidays.name: National Tell a Joke Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to spreading laughter by telling jokes, puns, and funny tales to friends, family, and even strangers!
holidays.origin: Originating in the U.S., it encourages humor to brighten people’s lives and reduce stress.
holidays.funFact: The world record for the longest joke ever told is over 68,000 words long — that's a LOT of laughter!

holidays.name: National Rum Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the iconic spirit distilled from sugarcane—rum! Perfect for enthusiasts to enjoy tropical drinks or learn about rum's rich history.
holidays.origin: An unofficial U.S. food holiday celebrating the versatile alcoholic beverage that has been popular since the 17th century.
holidays.funFact: Pirates famously favored rum, inspiring the term 'grog' when the British Navy mixed rum with water.

holidays.name: Airborne Day
holidays.description: Honoring the paratroopers and airborne forces who bravely serve and have shaped military history.
holidays.origin: Originated as a U.S. Army observance commemorating the first official use of airborne troops in 1940.
holidays.funFact: The first airborne operation in combat was during World War II at the Battle of Normandy in 1944.

holidays.name: Rollercoaster Day
holidays.description: A fun celebration for thrill-seekers to ride their favorite rollercoasters or reminisce about exciting amusement park adventures.
holidays.origin: Unofficial holiday celebrated mainly by theme park enthusiasts and ride lovers.
holidays.funFact: The world’s tallest rollercoaster is Kingda Ka in New Jersey, reaching a dizzying 456 feet!
